adjective.description: Having a top with a rolled or curled shape.
Especially of a writing desk, bureau, etc.: having a sliding top or cover, especially one made of parallel slats fastened to a flexible backing.

noun.description: The top or cover of a roll-top desk, especially one made of parallel slats fastened to a flexible backing.

origin: Mid 19th century; earliest use found in Hartford (Connecticut) Daily Courant. Partly from roll + top, and partly from roll + top.
